name: Image Similarity
description:
Image similarity is a technique in computer vision used to measure how similar two images are based on their visual content. 
 It is crucial in applications such as image retrieval, duplicate detection, and content-based image search. 
 Popular methods include feature extraction using SIFT (Scale-Invariant Feature Transform), SURF (Speeded-Up Robust Features), and deep learning approaches like CNNs and Siamese networks.
usecase: Used in content-based image retrieval, image clustering, and duplicate image detection.
challenges: Challenges include designing effective similarity metrics, handling scale and viewpoint variations, and computational efficiency.
popular_methods: Common methods include feature extraction (e.g., SIFT, SURF), deep learning-based approaches, and metric learning.
